B.Tech_Artificial Intelligence.program_title: Bachelor of Technology in Artificial Intelligence
B.Tech_Artificial Intelligence.program_rationale: This B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence is designed to address the growing demand for AI professionals in the global technology sector. The curriculum provides a rigorous foundation in machine learning, deep learning, and neural network architectures, preparing graduates to lead AI innovation across industries from healthcare to autonomous systems.

Semester 1.description: Introduction to AI concepts, history, and applications. Students learn problem-solving techniques, search algorithms, and basic reasoning methods.

weekly_topics.title: Introduction to AI
weekly_topics.description: History, Turing Test, and AI applications
resources: Russell & Norvig: AI A Modern Approach

outcomes.outcome: Design intelligent agents for complex environments

Semester 1.description: Comprehensive Python programming with focus on data manipulation, NumPy, Pandas, and visualization libraries essential for AI development.

weekly_topics.title: File I/O and APIs
weekly_topics.description: Working with JSON, CSV, and REST APIs

outcomes.outcome: Develop data processing pipelines in Python
Apply numerical computing for AI applications

Semester 1.description: Essential mathematical foundations including linear algebra, calculus, probability, and statistics required for understanding AI algorithms.

weekly_topics.title: Probability Theory
weekly_topics.description: Distributions, Bayes theorem, and conditional probability

outcomes.outcome: Apply linear algebra to ML model computations
Evaluate statistical models for data analysis

Semester 2.description: Core machine learning algorithms including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning with practical implementation.

outcomes.outcome: Evaluate model performance using appropriate metrics

Semester 2.description: Advanced data structures and algorithmic techniques essential for efficient AI system implementation.

weekly_topics.title: Trees and Graphs
weekly_topics.description: Binary trees, BST, and graph representations

outcomes.outcome: Design efficient data structures for AI applications

Semester 2.description: Introduction to neural networks, backpropagation, and deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.

weekly_topics.title: Optimization Algorithms
weekly_topics.description: SGD, Adam, and learning rate scheduling

outcomes.outcome: Build neural networks using modern frameworks

Semester 3.description: Image processing, object detection, and visual recognition using deep learning.

weekly_topics.title: Image Fundamentals
weekly_topics.description: Pixels, color spaces, and image representation

Semester 3.description: Text processing, language models, and NLP applications.

outcomes.outcome: Apply NLP techniques to text data

Semester 3.description: Advanced statistical methods essential for machine learning.

weekly_topics.title: Information Theory
weekly_topics.description: Entropy, KL divergence, and mutual information

outcomes.outcome: Apply statistical reasoning to AI problems

Semester 4.description: Sequential decision making and reward-based learning.

outcomes.outcome: Design RL agents for complex environments

Semester 4.description: Advanced neural network architectures and techniques.

Semester 5.description: Ethical considerations and responsible AI development.

weekly_topics.title: AI Regulation
weekly_topics.description: EU AI Act and global policies

outcomes.outcome: Evaluate AI systems for ethical compliance

Semester 5.description: AI for robotics and autonomous agents.

Semester 6.description: Building and deploying large language models.

outcomes.outcome: Deploy ML models on edge devices

Semester 6.description: AI applications in medical diagnosis and healthcare.

Semester 7.description: 16-week industry internship at an AI company.

outcomes.outcome: Apply AI skills in industry setting

Semester 8.description: Major project solving real-world AI problems - Phase 1.
Major project solving real-world AI problems - Phase 2.

B.Tech_Artificial Intelligence.industry_alignment_notes: This curriculum is aligned with industry demands from major tech companies including Google, Microsoft, and emerging AI startups.
optimization_tips: Add specialization tracks in NLP or Computer Vision
Include industry internship in final year

B.Tech_Data Science.program_title: Bachelor of Technology in Data Science
B.Tech_Data Science.program_rationale: This B.Tech in Data Science prepares students to extract insights from complex datasets and drive data-driven decision making. The curriculum combines statistical foundations, machine learning, and business analytics to produce graduates capable of transforming raw data into strategic value.

Semester 1.description: Overview of data science lifecycle, tools, and methodologies. Students learn to frame business problems as data science projects.

outcomes.outcome: Apply EDA techniques to real datasets

Semester 1.description: Statistical foundations for data science including probability distributions, hypothesis testing, and regression analysis.

outcomes.outcome: Apply statistical tests to validate hypotheses

Semester 1.description: Python programming with emphasis on data manipulation using Pandas, NumPy, and visualization with Matplotlib and Seaborn.

weekly_topics.title: Python Essentials
weekly_topics.description: Syntax, data types, and control flow

outcomes.outcome: Apply NLP for Data Science concepts
Apply Ethics in Data Science concepts

weekly_topics.title: AWS for Data Science
weekly_topics.description: Study of AWS for Data Science

outcomes.outcome: Apply Cloud Computing for DS concepts

B.Tech_Data Science.industry_alignment_notes: Aligned with data science roles at consulting firms, tech companies, and financial institutions.
optimization_tips: Add SQL and database management courses
Include capstone with real industry data

MBA_Marketing.program_title: Master of Business Administration in Marketing
MBA_Marketing.program_rationale: This MBA in Marketing develops strategic marketing leaders capable of driving brand growth in the digital age. The curriculum blends traditional marketing principles with cutting-edge digital strategies, analytics, and consumer behavior insights.

Semester 1.description: Comprehensive overview of marketing strategy, segmentation, targeting, positioning, and the marketing mix.

weekly_topics.title: Targeting and Positioning
resources: Positioning: The Battle for Your Mind

Semester 1.description: Understanding consumer decision-making processes, psychological factors, and cultural influences on buying behavior.

outcomes.outcome: Apply behavioral insights to marketing strategy

Semester 1.description: Comprehensive digital marketing covering SEO, SEM, social media, content marketing, and marketing automation.

weekly_topics.title: Paid Advertising
weekly_topics.description: Google Ads and social media advertising

MBA_Marketing.industry_alignment_notes: Aligned with marketing leadership roles at Fortune 500 companies and digital-first startups.

MBA_Finance.program_title: Master of Business Administration in Finance
MBA_Finance.program_rationale: This MBA in Finance prepares future financial leaders with expertise in corporate finance, investment analysis, and risk management. The curriculum combines theoretical rigor with practical applications in financial modeling and strategic decision-making.

Semester 1.description: Fundamental concepts of corporate finance including capital budgeting, cost of capital, and financing decisions.

outcomes.outcome: Evaluate investment decisions using financial metrics

Semester 1.description: Understanding the structure and function of financial markets, banking systems, and regulatory frameworks.

outcomes.outcome: Evaluate regulatory impact on financial institutions

Semester 1.description: Portfolio theory, asset valuation, and investment strategies for equity and fixed income securities.

MBA_Finance.industry_alignment_notes: Aligned with finance roles at investment banks, asset management firms, and corporate finance departments.

B.Tech_Cybersecurity.program_rationale: This B.Tech in Cybersecurity addresses the critical shortage of security professionals in the digital economy. The curriculum covers network security, ethical hacking, cryptography, and incident response, preparing graduates to protect organizations from evolving cyber threats.

Semester 1.description: Introduction to cybersecurity concepts, threat landscape, and security frameworks like NIST and ISO 27001.

weekly_topics.title: Threat Landscape
weekly_topics.description: Types of attacks and threat actors

outcomes.outcome: Apply security frameworks to organizational contexts

Semester 1.description: Network protocols, firewall configuration, intrusion detection, and secure network design principles.

weekly_topics.title: Network Protocols
weekly_topics.description: HTTP, DNS, DHCP, and security implications

outcomes.outcome: Analyze network traffic for security threats

Semester 1.description: Mathematical foundations of cryptography, symmetric and asymmetric encryption, hash functions, and digital signatures.

weekly_topics.title: Symmetric Encryption
weekly_topics.description: AES, DES, and block cipher modes

outcomes.outcome: Apply cryptographic techniques for data protection

B.Tech_Cybersecurity.industry_alignment_notes: Aligned with cybersecurity roles at enterprises, consulting firms, and government agencies.
optimization_tips: Include industry certifications like CEH and CompTIA Security+
